item.title: #TIL 2018-02-21 : til, networking, vim
item.description: NETWORKING List opening ports or listening UNIX sockets In Linux, you can use netstat to list all opening ports and listening UNIX sockets $ sudo netstat -npl Tip to remember command : network statistics - natual languge processing ;) VIM Convert tabs to spaces This is my config to use 4 spaces instead tab filetype plugin indent on set tabstop=4 set shiftwidth=4 set expandtab To convert existing file from tabs to spaces, use this command

item.title: #TIL 2018-01-30 : til, editor, vim
item.description: VIM Using mark to bookmark checkpoints in files Bookmarking a checkpoint will help you get back to it intermidately. Ex: your have to find some text to replace something but want to return back current position. Set a mark - [NORMAL MODE] , type m then follow by a letter from a-z (lowercase is filescope, uppercase for global scope - vim scope) Go to a mark - [NORMAL MODE] , type backstick ` then follow by the letter your marked above.
